title: Coolant Replacement - Drainage

body.body: D2053 OAT coolant contains corrosion inhibitors and antifreeze suitable for aluminium engines and radiators. Always use the coolant in accordance with the instructions of the manufacturer.
Coolant contains toxic chemicals that are harmful to the human body.
Contact with skin or eyes may cause severe irritation. Wear protective gloves, clothing and eye protection when handling coolant.
If coolant is inhaled, remove the person to fresh air and keep comfortable for breathing. In case of doubt or persistent symptoms, seek medical attention.
If coolant gets on your skin, flush with water immediately. Remove contaminated clothing.
If coolant gets in your eyes, flush with water for at least 15 minutes and SEEK MEDICAL ATTENTION IMMEDIATELY.
If coolant is swallowed, rinse the mouth with water and SEEK MEDICAL ATTENTION IMMEDIATELY.
KEEP COOLANT OUT OF THE REACH OF CHILDREN.
Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Coolant Drain CG7, CM7, CN7, CR7, CT7, CX7, CF7

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: CF7; CX7; CT7; CR7; CN7; CM7; CG7

body.body: Warning - Cooling - Do not remove the expansion tank or coolant pressure cap when engine is hot

Do not remove the expansion tank or coolant pressure cap when the engine is hot. When the engine is hot, the coolant inside the cooling system will be hot and may also be under pressure. Contact with hot coolant will cause scalds and skin damage.
Do not remove the coolant pressure cap if the expansion tank contains coolant.
If you remove the coolant pressure cap, the coolant in the expansion tank will be released and can spill over the motorcycle.
Prior to disassembly of the coolant hoses, note the orientation and position of the hose clips to help make sure that they are returned to the same positions and orientation on assembly.
for removal and installation of the coolant hose constant tension hose clips.
To fully drain the coolant, place the motorcycle on its side stand so that it is angled to the left side.
Remove the right fuel tank end panel (see
Position a container to collect the drained coolant.
Loosen the clip and loosen the top hose on the right radiator to allow air into the system.
Loosen the hose clip then release the bottom hose from the radiator and allow the coolant to drain.
Loosen the hose clips then release the heat exchanger hoses from the heat exchanger and allow the coolant to drain.
Triumph D2053 OAT is coloured orange compared to the Triumph HD4X OAT which is coloured green.
Do not mix D2053 OAT (orange) with HD4X OAT (green) antifreeze.
Mixing D2053 OAT and HD4X OAT will cause reduced corrosion resistance and the engine to overheat.
From VIN AG0784 the coolant was changed from Triumph HD4X Hybrid OAT coolant to Triumph D2053 OAT coolant.
If the Triumph HD4X Hybrid OAT coolant is drained the cooling system must be flushed through prior to filling the cooling system with the Triumph D2053 OAT coolant.
If the coolant system needs to be fully drained, remove and drain the coolant expansion tank (see

D2053 OAT coolant contains corrosion inhibitors and antifreeze suitable for aluminium engines and radiators. Always use the coolant in accordance with the instructions of the manufacturer.
Coolant contains toxic chemicals that are harmful to the human body.
Contact with skin or eyes may cause severe irritation. Wear protective gloves, clothing and eye protection when handling coolant.
If coolant is inhaled, remove the person to fresh air and keep comfortable for breathing. In case of doubt or persistent symptoms, seek medical attention.
If coolant gets on your skin, flush with water immediately. Remove contaminated clothing.
If coolant gets in your eyes, flush with water for at least 15 minutes and SEEK MEDICAL ATTENTION IMMEDIATELY.
If coolant is swallowed, rinse the mouth with water and SEEK MEDICAL ATTENTION IMMEDIATELY.
KEEP COOLANT OUT OF THE REACH OF CHILDREN.
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Perform the following operations:
Plastic Sump Guard - Removal
Fuel Tank - Removal

Do not remove the expansion tank or coolant pressure cap when the engine is hot. When the engine is hot, the coolant inside the cooling system will be hot and may also be under pressure. Contact with hot coolant will cause scalds and skin damage.
Do not remove the coolant pressure cap if the expansion tank contains coolant.
If you remove the coolant pressure cap, the coolant in the expansion tank will be released and can spill over the motorcycle.
Prior to disassembly of the coolant hoses, note the orientation and position of the hose clips to help make sure that they are returned to the same positions and orientation on assembly.
Use
service tool T3880207
for removal and installation of the coolant hose constant tension hose clips.
To fully drain the coolant, place the motorcycle on its side stand so that it is angled to the left side.
Remove the right fuel tank end panel (see
Fuel Tank End Panel - Removal
Position a container to collect the drained coolant.
Loosen the clip and loosen the top hose on the right radiator to allow air into the system.
Loosen the hose clip then release the bottom hose from the radiator and allow the coolant to drain.

Triumph D2053 OAT is coloured orange compared to the Triumph HD4X OAT which is coloured green.
Do not mix D2053 OAT (orange) with HD4X OAT (green) antifreeze.
Mixing D2053 OAT and HD4X OAT will cause reduced corrosion resistance and the engine to overheat.
From VIN AG0784 the coolant was changed from Triumph HD4X Hybrid OAT coolant to Triumph D2053 OAT coolant.
If the Triumph HD4X Hybrid OAT coolant is drained the cooling system must be flushed through prior to filling the cooling system with the Triumph D2053 OAT coolant.
